demographics.name: Alice Brown
demographics.emergencyContact: Michael Brown (Husband) - 555-2234 (Relationship: Spouse). Primary contact for medical updates.
demographics.advanceDirectives: Full Code (On File, verified 03/27/2025 during initial Rad Onc consult). Patient has designated healthcare proxy.
demographics.supportServices: Referred to Physical Therapy (for protected weight bearing and mobility training). Oncology Social Worker referral for emotional support. Pain management consult for optimization of pain control. Referral to local breast cancer support groups.
demographics.mobility: Ambulatory with significant worsening right hip/thigh pain. Requires walker for ambulation due to pain and fracture risk. ECOG Performance Status 2. KPS 70. Difficulty bearing full weight on right leg. Protected weight-bearing status advised by Ortho Onc.

diagnosis.primary: Metastatic Breast Cancer (Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, ER+/PR+/HER2-)
diagnosis.location: Right Proximal Femur (Lytic lesion involving femoral neck and intertrochanteric region)
diagnosis.datePathologicDiagnosis: Primary Breast Cancer: 2018. Bone Metastasis Confirmation: 03/20/2025 (MRI and PET/CT findings consistent with metastasis, biopsy deferred given history).
diagnosis.tnmStage: TX N1 M1 (Osseous metastasis to right femur) - Stage IV
diagnosis.tumorSize: Lytic lesion in right femur approx. 4.5 cm in largest dimension, with associated cortical thinning.
diagnosis.vascularInvolvement: Not applicable for bone metastasis. No neurovascular compromise of the extremity noted on exam.
diagnosis.pathologicStage: Biopsy of bone lesion deferred. Staging based on clinical and radiographic evidence.
diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: Progressive right hip and thigh pain for 6 weeks, worsening with weight-bearing. Pain level 7/10 at baseline, 9/10 with activity. Using walker. Pain disturbs sleep.
pathologyFindings: Primary Breast Cancer (2018): Invasive Ductal Carcinoma, Grade 2. ER positive (90%), PR positive (70%), HER2 negative (IHC 1+).
Bone Metastasis (03/2025): Radiographic appearance on MRI and PET/CT is characteristic of lytic metastatic disease. Consistent with patient's known breast cancer history.
diagnosis.relevantHistory: Diagnosed with Stage IIB (T2 N1 M0) ER+/PR+/HER2- breast cancer in 2018. Treated with lumpectomy, adjuvant chemotherapy (AC-T), and adjuvant whole breast radiation. Has been on adjuvant endocrine therapy (Letrozole) since 2019. No other sites of metastasis currently identified.
diagnosis.baselineStatus: ECOG 2 due to pain and mobility restrictions. KPS 70. Alert and oriented.
diagnosis.pftSummary: Not indicated for this treatment site.

treatmentPlan.surgOnc: Dr. Sarah Chen (Orthopedic Oncology - consulted, recommended RT first due to fracture risk not being imminent but high)
treatmentPlan.intent: Palliative - Goal is pain relief and bone stabilization to prevent pathologic fracture.
treatmentPlan.rtRxDetails: 2000 cGy in 5 fractions (400 cGy/fx), delivered daily (Mon-Fri).
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: Gross Tumor Volume (GTV) defined as the lytic lesion visible on CT/MRI. Clinical Target Volume (CTV) includes GTV plus the entire involved bony compartment (proximal femur, including femoral head/neck and intertrochanteric region) to account for microscopic disease. Planning Target Volume (PTV) is CTV + 0.7 cm margin for setup uncertainty.
treatmentPlan.techniqueSummary: Opposed Anterior-Posterior (AP) and Posterior-Anterior (PA) fields utilizing 6MV photons. Field borders cover the entire PTV with adequate margins. Multileaf collimators (MLCs) used to shape fields and shield surrounding soft tissue. Plan normalized to deliver prescription dose to mid-depth.
treatmentPlan.concurrentChemo: None (Endocrine therapy held during RT, to resume post-RT).
medications: Oxycodone 5mg PO q4-6h PRN severe pain (Currently taking 3-4 times daily).
Senna-S 2 tabs PO daily (for opioid-induced constipation).
Letrozole 2.5mg PO daily (Holding during RT course).
therapistAlerts: **PROTECTED WEIGHT BEARING** on Right Leg. Patient uses a walker. Verify understanding at each session.
Fall Risk - provide assistance for transfers on/off treatment couch.
Assess pain level and medication use daily. Report worsening pain to MD immediately.
Daily kV imaging required for setup verification (match to bony anatomy).
Ensure comfort on couch - may need knee sponge support under left leg.

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine in custom Vac-Lok bag (legs/pelvis) with legs in a custom ankle/foot immobilization device for rotational stability. Arms crossed over chest. Patient instructed to breathe normally. SSD setup (Source to Skin Distance).
ctSimulation.immobilization: Vac-Lok bag (custom molded for legs/pelvis), ankle/foot immobilization device (e.g., Alpha Cradle), knee sponge.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: 3-point tattoos for alignment (at right hip, right mid-thigh, and midline). Additional marks outlining field borders. Isocenter placed at center of lytic lesion in right proximal femur. Coordinates recorded and verified by RTs and physicist.
